Go support his work with likes and follows.\n\n```{r }                   \n#| label: submission\n#| warning: false\n#| message: false\n\nadd_top_columns <- function(data, n_top = 3) {\n  data_temp <- data |>\n    mutate(row_id = row_number()) |>\n    pivot_longer(cols = -row_id, names_to = \"variable\", values_to = \"value\") |>\n    group_by(row_id) |>\n    arrange(desc(value), .by_group = TRUE) |>\n    mutate(rank = paste0(\"top\", 1:n())) |>\n    filter(rank %in% paste0(\"top\", 1:n_top)) |>\n    select(-value) |>\n    pivot_wider(names_from = rank, values_from = variable) |>\n    ungroup() |>\n    select(-row_id)\n  \n    data <- bind_cols(data_temp, data) |> \n    mutate(\n    across(c(top1, top2, top3), ~str_replace_all(.x, \"\\\\.pred_\", replacement = \"\")),\n       across(c(top1, top2, top3), ~str_replace_all(.x, \"_\", replacement = \"-\")),\n       fertilizer_name = str_c(top1,\" \", top2, \" \", top3)\n       ) |> \n      select(-c(top1, top2, top3))\n    \n    return(data)\n}\n\n                   \naugment(classification_fit, train_df) %>% \n  conf_mat(fertilizer_name, .pred_class) %>%\n  yardstick:::autoplot.conf_mat(type = \"heatmap\") +\n  scale_fill_distiller(palette = \"RdPu\")\n                   \nsubmit_df <- predict(classification_fit, competition_df, type = \"prob\") |> \n  add_top_columns(n_top = 3) |> \n  rename(`Fertilizer Name` = fertilizer_name) |> \n  bind_cols(competition_df) |> \n  select(id, `Fertilizer Name`)\n\nhead(submit_df)  %>% \n     knitr::kable()      \n\nsubmit_df  %>% \n  write_csv(\"submission.csv\")\n```  ","metadata":{"_uuid":"3617fcf5-c559-4af9-8589-bd0240ae0ca0","_cell_guid":"9b508bf9-9db1-4324-87f0-c9e7019a37ae","trusted":true,"collapsed":false,"jupyter":{"outputs_hidden":false}},"outputs":[],"execution_count":null}]}
